trans-unit.source: Represents a dynamic operation.
Dispatches to the specific visit method for this node type.

For example, <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.MethodCallExpression"></xref> calls the <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(System.Linq.Expressions.MethodCallExpression)"></xref>.
This default implementation for <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Extension> nodes calls <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitExtension%2A>.
Override this method to call into a more specific method on a derived visitor class of the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor> class.
However, it should still support unknown visitors by calling <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitExtension%2A>.
The visitor to visit this node with.
The result of visiting this node.
Gets the arguments to the dynamic operation.
The read-only collections containing the arguments to the dynamic operation.
Gets the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder"></xref>, which determines the run-time behavior of the dynamic site.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder"></xref>, which determines the run-time behavior of the dynamic site.
Gets the type of the delegate used by the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> object representing the type of the delegate used by the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite"></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that represents a dynamic operation bound by the provided <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.DelegateType%2A> property of the result is inferred from the types of the arguments and the specified return type.
The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The result type of the dynamic expression.
The arguments to the dynamic operation.

A <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that has <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.NodeType"></xref> equal to <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Dynamic"></xref>, and has the <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Binder"></xref> and <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Arguments"></xref> set to the specified values.
Creates a <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that represents a dynamic operation bound by the provided <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.DelegateType%2A> property of the result is inferred from the types of the arguments and the specified return type.
The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The result type of the dynamic expression.
The first argument to the dynamic operation.

The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The result type of the dynamic expression.
The arguments to the dynamic operation.

The result type of the dynamic expression.
The first argument to the dynamic operation.
The second argument to the dynamic operation.

The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The result type of the dynamic expression.
The first argument to the dynamic operation.
The second argument to the dynamic operation.
The third argument to the dynamic operation.
The fourth argument to the dynamic operation.

Creates a <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that represents a dynamic operation bound by the provided <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder"></xref> and four arguments.
The type of the delegate used by the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite"></xref>.
The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The first argument to the dynamic operation.
The second argument to the dynamic operation.
The third argument to the dynamic operation.
The fourth argument to the dynamic operation.

The type of the delegate used by the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite"></xref>.
The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The first argument to the dynamic operation.
The second argument to the dynamic operation.
The third argument to the dynamic operation.

A <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that has <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.NodeType"></xref> equal to <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Dynamic"></xref>, and has the <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.DelegateType"></xref>, <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Binder"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Arguments"></xref> set to the specified values.

Creates a <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that represents a dynamic operation bound by the provided <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder"></xref> and two arguments.
The type of the delegate used by the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite"></xref>.
The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The first argument to the dynamic operation.
The second argument to the dynamic operation.

Creates a <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that represents a dynamic operation bound by the provided <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder"></xref> and one argument.
The type of the delegate used by the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite"></xref>.
The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The argument to the dynamic operation.

The type of the delegate used by the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite"></xref>.
The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The arguments to the dynamic operation.

A <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that has <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.NodeType"></xref> equal to <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Dynamic"></xref>, and has the <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.DelegateType"></xref>, <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Binder"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Arguments"></xref> set to the specified values.
Creates a <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that represents a dynamic operation bound by the provided <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder"></xref>.
The type of the delegate used by the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite"></xref>.
The runtime binder for the dynamic operation.
The arguments to the dynamic operation.

A <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression"></xref> that has <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.NodeType"></xref> equal to <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Dynamic"></xref>, and has the <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.DelegateType"></xref>, <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Binder"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Arguments"></xref> set to the specified values.
Returns the node type of this expression.
Extension nodes should return <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Extension"></xref> when overriding this method.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType"></xref> of the expression.
Gets the static type of the expression that this <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> represents.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Type"></xref> that represents the static type of the expression.
Compares the value sent to the parameter, arguments, to the `Arguments` property of the current instance of `DynamicExpression`.
If the values of the parameter and the property are equal, the current instance is returned.
If they are not equal, a new `DynamicExpression` instance is returned that is identical to the current instance except that the `Arguments` property is set to the value of parameter arguments.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression.Arguments"></xref> property of the result.
This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.
Returns the number of arguments to the expression tree node.
You should not use this member.
It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.
Returns <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
Returns the argument at index, throwing if index is out of bounds.
You should not use this member.
It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.
The index of the argument.
Returns <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref>.
Optionally creates the CallSite and returns the CallSite for the DynamicExpression’s polymorphic inline cache.
You should not use this member.
It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.
Returns <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Rewrite this node replacing the dynamic expression’s arguments with the provided values.
The number of args needs to match the number of the current expression.
You should not use this type.
It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.
This helper method allows re-writing of nodes to be independent of the specific implementation class deriving from DynamicExpression that is being used at the call site.
The arguments.
Returns <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref>, the rewritten expression.
